001package squidpony.squidmath;
002
003/**
004 * A container class for various interfaces and implementing classes that affect continuous noise, such as that produced
005 * by {@link FastNoise} or {@link SeededNoise}, as well as static utility methods used throughout noise code.
006 * <br>
007 * Created by Tommy Ettinger on 3/17/2017.
008 */
009public class Noise {
010    public static final SeededNoise alternate = new SeededNoise(0xFEEDCAFE);
011    /**
012     * Like {@link Math#floor}, but returns a long.
013     * Doesn't consider "weird doubles" like INFINITY and NaN.
014     *
015     * @param t the double to find the floor for
016     * @return the floor of t, as a long
017     */
018    public static long longFloor(double t) {
019        return t >= 0.0 ? (long) t : (long) t - 1L;
020    }
021    /**
022     * Like {@link Math#floor(double)}, but takes a float and returns a long.
023     * Doesn't consider "weird floats" like INFINITY and NaN.
024     *
025     * @param t the double to find the floor for
026     * @return the floor of t, as a long
027     */
028    public static long longFloor(float t) {
029        return t >= 0f ? (long) t : (long) t - 1L;
030    }
031    /**
032     * Like {@link Math#floor(double)} , but returns an int.
033     * Doesn't consider "weird doubles" like INFINITY and NaN.
034     * @param t the float to find the floor for
035     * @return the floor of t, as an int
036     */
037    public static int fastFloor(double t) {
038        return t >= 0.0 ? (int) t : (int) t - 1;
039    }
040    /**
041     * Like {@link Math#floor(double)}, but takes a float and returns an int.
042     * Doesn't consider "weird floats" like INFINITY and NaN.
043     * @param t the float to find the floor for
044     * @return the floor of t, as an int
045     */
046    public static int fastFloor(float t) {
047        return t >= 0f ? (int) t : (int) t - 1;
048    }
049    /**
050     * Like {@link Math#ceil(double)}, but returns an int.
051     * Doesn't consider "weird doubles" like INFINITY and NaN.
052     * @param t the float to find the ceiling for
053     * @return the ceiling of t, as an int
054     */
055    public static int fastCeil(double t) {
056        return t >= 0.0 ? -(int) -t + 1: -(int)-t;
057    }
058    /**
059     * Like {@link Math#ceil(double)}, but takes a float and returns an int.
060     * Doesn't consider "weird floats" like INFINITY and NaN.
061     * @param t the float to find the ceiling for
062     * @return the ceiling of t, as an int
063     */
064    public static int fastCeil(float t) {
065        return t >= 0f ? -(int) -t + 1: -(int)-t;
066    }
067
068    /**
069     * Cubic-interpolates between start and end (valid doubles), with a between 0 (yields start) and 1 (yields end).
070     * Will smoothly transition toward start or end as a approaches 0 or 1, respectively. Somewhat faster than
071     * quintic interpolation ({@link #querp(double, double, double)}), but slower (and smoother) than
072     * {@link  #lerp(double, double, double)}.
073     * @param start a valid double
074     * @param end a valid double
075     * @param a a double between 0 and 1 inclusive
076     * @return a double between start and end inclusive
077     */
078    public static double cerp(final double start, final double end, double a) {
079        return (1.0 - (a *= a * (3.0 - 2.0 * a))) * start + a * end;
080    }
081
082    /**
083     * Cubic-interpolates between start and end (valid floats), with a between 0 (yields start) and 1 (yields end).
084     * Will smoothly transition toward start or end as a approaches 0 or 1, respectively. Somewhat faster than
085     * quintic interpolation ({@link #querp(float, float, float)}), but slower (and smoother) than
086     * {@link #lerp(float, float, float)}.
087     * @param start a valid float
088     * @param end a valid float
089     * @param a a float between 0 and 1 inclusive
090     * @return a float between start and end inclusive
091     */
092    public static float cerp(final float start, final float end, float a) {
093        return (1f - (a *= a * (3f - 2f * a))) * start + a * end;
094    }
095    /*
096     * Quintic-interpolates between start and end (valid doubles), with a between 0 (yields start) and 1 (yields end).
097     * Will smoothly transition toward start or end as a approaches 0 or 1, respectively.
098     * @param start a valid double, as in, not infinite or NaN
099     * @param end a valid double, as in, not infinite or NaN
100     * @param a a double between 0 and 1 inclusive
101     * @return a double between x and y inclusive
102     */
103    public static double querp(final double start, final double end, double a){
104        return (1.0 - (a *= a * a * (a * (a * 6.0 - 15.0) + 10.0))) * start + a * end;
105    }
106    /*
107     * Quintic-interpolates between start and end (valid floats), with a between 0 (yields start) and 1 (yields end).
108     * Will smoothly transition toward start or end as a approaches 0 or 1, respectively.
109     * @param start a valid float, as in, not infinite or NaN
110     * @param end a valid float, as in, not infinite or NaN
111     * @param a a float between 0 and 1 inclusive
112     * @return a float between x and y inclusive
113     */
114    public static float querp(final float start, final float end, float a){
115        return (1f - (a *= a * a * (a * (a * 6f - 15f) + 10f))) * start + a * end;
116    }
117
118
119    /**
120     * Linear-interpolates between start and end (valid doubles), with a between 0 (yields start) and 1 (yields end).
121     * @param start a valid double, as in, not infinite or NaN
122     * @param end a valid double, as in, not infinite or NaN
123     * @param a a double between 0 and 1 inclusive
124     * @return a double between x and y inclusive
125     */
126    public static double lerp(final double start, final double end, final double a) {
127        return (1.0 - a) * start + a * end;
128    }
129
130    /**
131     * Linear-interpolates between start and end (valid floats), with a between 0 (yields start) and 1 (yields end).
132     * @param start a valid float, as in, not infinite or NaN
133     * @param end a valid float, as in, not infinite or NaN
134     * @param a a float between 0 and 1 inclusive
135     * @return a float between x and y inclusive
136     */
137    public static float lerp(final float start, final float end, final float a) {
138        return (1f - a) * start + a * end;
139    }
140
141    /**
142     * Given a float {@code a} from 0.0 to 1.0 (both inclusive), this gets a float that adjusts a to be closer to the
143     * end points of that range (if less than 0.5, it gets closer to 0.0, otherwise it gets closer to 1.0).
144     * @param a a float between 0.0f and 1.0f inclusive
145     * @return a float between 0.0f and 1.0f inclusive that is more likely to be near the extremes
146     */
147    public static double emphasize(final double a)
148    {
149        return a * a * (3.0 - 2.0 * a);
150    }
151    /**
152     * Given a float {@code a} from -1.0 to 1.0 (both inclusive), this gets a float that adjusts a to be closer to the
153     * end points of that range (if less than 0, it gets closer to -1.0, otherwise it gets closer to 1.0).
154     * <br>
155     * Used by {@link ClassicNoise} and {@link  JitterNoise} to increase the frequency of high and low results, which
156     * improves the behavior of {@link Ridged2D} and other Ridged noise when it uses those noise algorithms.
157     * @param a a float between -1.0f and 1.0f inclusive
158     * @return a float between -1.0f and 1.0f inclusive that is more likely to be near the extremes
159     */
160    public static double emphasizeSigned(double a)
161    {         
162        a = a * 0.5 + 0.5;
163        return a * a * (6.0 - 4.0 * a) - 1.0;
164    }
165
166    /**
167     * Given a double {@code a} from 0.0 to 1.0 (both inclusive), this gets a double that adjusts a to be much closer to
168     * the end points of that range (if less than 0.5, it gets closer to 0.0, otherwise it gets closer to 1.0).
169     * @param a a double between 0.0 and 1.0 inclusive
170     * @return a double between 0.0 and 1.0 inclusive that is more likely to be near the extremes
171     */
172    public static double extreme(final double a)
173    {
174        return a * a * a * (a * (a * 6 - 15) + 10);
175    }
176
177    /**
178     * Given a double {@code a} from -1.0 to 1.0 (both inclusive), this gets a double that adjusts a to be much closer
179     * to the end points of that range (if less than 0, it gets closer to -1.0, otherwise it gets closer to 1.0).
180     * @param a a double between -1.0 and 1.0 inclusive
181     * @return a double between -1.0 and 1.0 inclusive that is more likely to be near the extremes
182     */
183    public static double extremeSigned(double a)
184    {
185        a = a * 0.5 + 0.5;
186        return a * a * a * (a * (a * 12 - 30) + 20) - 1.0;
187    }
188
189    public interface Noise1D {
190        double getNoise(double x);
191        double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, long seed);
192    }
193
194    public interface Noise2D {
195        double getNoise(double x, double y);
196        double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, double y, long seed);
197    }
198
199    public interface Noise3D {
200        double getNoise(double x, double y, double z);
201        double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, double y, double z, long seed);
202    }
203
204    public interface Noise4D {
205        double getNoise(double x, double y, double z, double w);
206        double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, double y, double z, double w, long seed);
207    }
208
209    public interface Noise5D {
210        double getNoise(double x, double y, double z, double w, double u);
211        double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, double y, double z, double w, double u, long seed);
212    }
213
214    public interface Noise6D {
215        double getNoise(double x, double y, double z, double w, double u, double v);
216        double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, double y, double z, double w, double u, double v, long seed);
217    }
218
219    public static class Layered1D implements Noise1D {
220        protected int octaves;
221        protected Noise1D basis;
222        public double frequency;
223        public double lacunarity;
224        public Layered1D() {
225            this(Basic1D.instance);
226        }
227
228        public Layered1D(Noise1D basis) {
229            this(basis, 2);
230        }
231
232        public Layered1D(Noise1D basis, final int octaves) {
233            this(basis, octaves, 1.0);
234        }
235        public Layered1D(Noise1D basis, final int octaves, double frequency) {
236            this(basis, octaves, frequency, 0.5);
237        }
238        public Layered1D(Noise1D basis, final int octaves, double frequency, double lacunarity) {
239            this.basis = basis;
240            this.frequency = frequency;
241            this.octaves = Math.max(1, Math.min(63, octaves));
242            this.lacunarity = lacunarity;
243        }
244
245
246        @Override
247        public double getNoise(double x) {
248            x *= frequency;
249            int s = 1;
250            double n = 0.0, i_s = 1.0 / lacunarity;
251            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s <<= 1) {
252                n += basis.getNoise(x * (i_s *= lacunarity) + (o << 6)) * s;
253            }
254            return n / ((1 << octaves) - 1.0);
255        }
256
257        @Override
258        public double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, long seed) {
259            x *= frequency;
260            int s = 1;
261            double n = 0.0, i_s = 1.0 / lacunarity;
262            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s <<= 1) {
263                n += basis.getNoiseWithSeed(x * (i_s *= lacunarity), (seed += 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L)) * s;
264            }
265            return n / ((1 << octaves) - 1.0);
266        }
267    }
268
269    public static class Layered2D implements Noise2D {
270        protected int octaves;
271        protected Noise2D basis;
272        public double frequency;
273        public double lacunarity;
274        public Layered2D() {
275            this(SeededNoise.instance);
276        }
277
278        public Layered2D(Noise2D basis) {
279            this(basis, 2);
280        }
281
282        public Layered2D(Noise2D basis, final int octaves) {
283            this(basis, octaves, 1.0);
284        }
285        public Layered2D(Noise2D basis, final int octaves, double frequency) {
286            this(basis, octaves, frequency, 0.5);
287        }
288        public Layered2D(Noise2D basis, final int octaves, double frequency, double lacunarity) {
289            this.basis = basis;
290            this.frequency = frequency;
291            this.octaves = Math.max(1, Math.min(63, octaves));
292            this.lacunarity = lacunarity;
293        }
294
295        @Override
296        public double getNoise(double x, double y) {
297            x *= frequency;
298            y *= frequency;
299            int s = 1;
300            double n = 0.0, i_s = 1.0 / lacunarity;
301            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s <<= 1) {
302                n += basis.getNoise(x * (i_s *= lacunarity) + (o << 6), y * i_s + (o << 7)) * s;
303            }
304            return n / ((1 << octaves) - 1.0);
305        }
306
307        @Override
308        public double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, double y, long seed) {
309            x *= frequency;
310            y *= frequency;
311            int s = 1;
312            double n = 0.0, i_s = 1.0 / lacunarity;
313            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s <<= 1) {
314                n += basis.getNoiseWithSeed(x * (i_s *= lacunarity), y * i_s, (seed += 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L)) * s;
315            }
316            return n / ((1 << octaves) - 1.0);
317        }
318    }
319    public static class Layered3D implements Noise3D {
320        protected int octaves;
321        protected Noise3D basis;
322        public double frequency;
323        public double lacunarity;

325            this(SeededNoise.instance);
326        }

329            this(basis, 2);
330        }
331
332        public Layered3D(Noise3D basis, final int octaves) {
333            this(basis, octaves, 1.0);
334        }
335        public Layered3D(Noise3D basis, final int octaves, double frequency) {
336            this(basis, octaves, frequency, 0.5);
337        }
338        public Layered3D(Noise3D basis, final int octaves, double frequency, double lacunarity) {
339            this.basis = basis;
340            this.frequency = frequency;
341            this.octaves = Math.max(1, Math.min(63, octaves));
342            this.lacunarity = lacunarity;
343        }
344
345        @Override
346        public double getNoise(double x, double y, double z) {
347            x *= frequency;
348            y *= frequency;
349            z *= frequency;
350            int s = 1;
351            double n = 0.0, i_s = 1.0 / lacunarity;
352            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s <<= 1) {
353                n += basis.getNoise(x * (i_s *= lacunarity) + (o << 6), y * i_s + (o << 7), z * i_s + (o << 8)) * s;
354            }
355            return n / ((1 << octaves) - 1.0);
356        }
357
358        @Override
359        public double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, double y, double z, long seed) {
360            x *= frequency;
361            y *= frequency;
362            z *= frequency;
363            int s = 1;
364            double n = 0.0, i_s = 1.0 / lacunarity;
365            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s <<= 1) {
366                n += basis.getNoiseWithSeed(x * (i_s *= lacunarity), y * i_s, z * i_s, (seed += 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L)) * s;
367            }
368            return n / ((1 << octaves) - 1.0);
369        }
370    }
371    public static class Layered4D implements Noise4D {
372        protected int octaves;
373        protected Noise4D basis;
374        public double frequency;
375        public double lacunarity;
376        public Layered4D() {
377            this(SeededNoise.instance);
378        }
379
380        public Layered4D(Noise4D basis) {
381            this(basis, 2);
382        }
383
384        public Layered4D(Noise4D basis, final int octaves) {
385            this(basis, octaves, 1.0);
386        }
387        public Layered4D(Noise4D basis, final int octaves, double frequency) {
388            this(basis, octaves, frequency, 0.5);
389        }
390        public Layered4D(Noise4D basis, final int octaves, double frequency, double lacunarity) {
391            this.basis = basis;
392            this.frequency = frequency;
393            this.octaves = Math.max(1, Math.min(63, octaves));
394            this.lacunarity = lacunarity;
395        }
396
397        @Override
398        public double getNoise(double x, double y, double z, double w) {
399            x *= frequency;
400            y *= frequency;
401            z *= frequency;
402            w *= frequency;
403            int s = 1;
404            double n = 0.0, i_s = 1.0 / lacunarity;
405            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s <<= 1) {
406                n += basis.getNoise(x * (i_s *= lacunarity) + (o << 6), y * i_s + (o << 7), z * i_s + (o << 8), w * i_s + (o << 9)) * s;
407            }
408            return n / ((1 << octaves) - 1.0);
409        }
410
411        @Override
412        public double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, double y, double z, double w, long seed) {
413            x *= frequency;
414            y *= frequency;
415            z *= frequency;
416            w *= frequency;
417            int s = 1;
418            double n = 0.0, i_s = 1.0 / lacunarity;
419            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s <<= 1) {
420                n += basis.getNoiseWithSeed(x * (i_s *= lacunarity), y * i_s, z * i_s, w * i_s, (seed += 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L)) * s;
421            }
422            return n / ((1 << octaves) - 1.0);
423        }
424    }
425    public static class Layered5D implements Noise5D {
426        protected int octaves;
427        protected Noise5D basis;
428        public double frequency;
429        public double lacunarity;
430        public Layered5D() {
431            this(SeededNoise.instance);
432        }
433
434        public Layered5D(Noise5D basis) {
435            this(basis, 2);
436        }
437
438        public Layered5D(Noise5D basis, final int octaves) {
439            this(basis, octaves, 1.0);
440        }
441        public Layered5D(Noise5D basis, final int octaves, double frequency) {
442            this(basis, octaves, frequency, 0.5);
443        }
444        public Layered5D(Noise5D basis, final int octaves, double frequency, double lacunarity) {
445            this.basis = basis;
446            this.frequency = frequency;
447            this.octaves = Math.max(1, Math.min(63, octaves));
448            this.lacunarity = lacunarity;
449        }
450
451        @Override
452        public double getNoise(double x, double y, double z, double w, double u) {
453            x *= frequency;
454            y *= frequency;
455            z *= frequency;
456            w *= frequency;
457            u *= frequency;
458            int s = 1;
459            double n = 0.0, i_s = 1.0 / lacunarity;
460            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s <<= 1) {
461                n += basis.getNoise(x * (i_s *= lacunarity) + (o << 6), y * i_s + (o << 7), z * i_s + (o << 8)
462                        , w * i_s + (o << 9), u * i_s + (o << 10)) * s;
463            }
464            return n / ((1 << octaves) - 1.0);
465        }
466
467        @Override
468        public double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, double y, double z, double w, double u, long seed) {
469            x *= frequency;
470            y *= frequency;
471            z *= frequency;
472            w *= frequency;
473            u *= frequency;
474            int s = 1;
475            double n = 0.0, i_s = 1.0 / lacunarity;
476            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s <<= 1) {
477                n += basis.getNoiseWithSeed(x * (i_s *= lacunarity), y * i_s, z * i_s
478                        , w * i_s, u * i_s, (seed += 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L)) * s;
479            }
480            return n / ((1 << octaves) - 1.0);
481        }
482    }

484    public static class Layered6D implements Noise6D {
485        protected int octaves;
486        protected Noise6D basis;
487        public double frequency;
488        public double lacunarity;
489        public Layered6D() {
490            this(SeededNoise.instance);
491        }
492
493        public Layered6D(Noise6D basis) {
494            this(basis, 2);
495        }
496
497        public Layered6D(Noise6D basis, final int octaves) {
498            this(basis, octaves, 1.0);
499        }
500        public Layered6D(Noise6D basis, final int octaves, double frequency) {
501            this(basis, octaves, frequency, 0.5);
502        }
503        public Layered6D(Noise6D basis, final int octaves, double frequency, double lacunarity) {
504            this.basis = basis;
505            this.frequency = frequency;
506            this.octaves = Math.max(1, Math.min(63, octaves));
507            this.lacunarity = lacunarity;
508        }
509
510        @Override
511        public double getNoise(double x, double y, double z, double w, double u, double v) {
512            x *= frequency;
513            y *= frequency;
514            z *= frequency;
515            w *= frequency;
516            u *= frequency;
517            v *= frequency;
518            int s = 1;
519            double n = 0.0, i_s = 1.0 / lacunarity;
520            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s <<= 1) {
521                n += basis.getNoise(x * (i_s *= lacunarity) + (o << 6), y * i_s + (o << 7), z * i_s + (o << 8)
522                        , w * i_s + (o << 9), u * i_s + (o << 10), v * i_s + (o << 11)) * s;
523            }
524            return n / ((1 << octaves) - 1.0);
525        }
526
527        @Override
528        public double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, double y, double z, double w, double u, double v, long seed) {
529            x *= frequency;
530            y *= frequency;
531            z *= frequency;
532            w *= frequency;
533            u *= frequency;
534            v *= frequency;
535            int s = 1;
536            double n = 0.0, i_s = 1.0 / lacunarity;
537            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s <<= 1) {
538                n += basis.getNoiseWithSeed(x * (i_s *= lacunarity), y * i_s, z * i_s
539                        , w * i_s, u * i_s, v * i_s, (seed += 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L)) * s;
540            }
541            return n / ((1 << octaves) - 1.0);
542        }
543    }
544
545    public static class Warped1D extends Layered1D {
546        public Warped1D() {
547            this(Basic1D.instance);
548        }
549
550        public Warped1D(Noise1D basis) {
551            this(basis, 2);
552        }
553
554        public Warped1D(Noise1D basis, final int octaves) {
555            this(basis, octaves, 1.0);
556        }
557        public Warped1D(Noise1D basis, final int octaves, double frequency) {
558            this(basis, octaves, frequency, 0.5);
559        }
560        public Warped1D(Noise1D basis, final int octaves, double frequency, double lacunarity) {
561            this.basis = basis;
562            this.frequency = frequency;
563            this.octaves = Math.max(1, Math.min(63, octaves));
564            this.lacunarity = lacunarity;
565        }
566
567
568        @Override
569        public double getNoise(double x) {
570            x *= frequency;
571            int s = 1;
572            double n = 0.0, i_s = 1.0 / lacunarity, prev = 0.0;
573            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s <<= 1) {
574                n += (prev = basis.getNoise(x * (i_s *= lacunarity) + (o << 6) + prev * 0.25)) * s;
575            }
576            return n / ((1 << octaves) - 1.0);
577        }
578
579        @Override
580        public double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, long seed) {
581            x *= frequency;
582            int s = 1;
583            double n = 0.0, i_s = 1.0 / lacunarity, prev = 0.0;
584            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s <<= 1) {
585                n += (prev = basis.getNoiseWithSeed(x * (i_s *= lacunarity) + prev * 0.25, (seed += 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L))) * s;
586            }
587            return n / ((1 << octaves) - 1.0);
588        }
589    }

847    public static class InverseLayered1D implements Noise1D {
848        protected int octaves;
849        protected Noise1D basis;
850        public double frequency;
851        /**
852         * A multiplier that affects how much the frequency changes with each layer; the default is 0.5 .
853         */
854        public double lacunarity = 0.5;
855        public InverseLayered1D() {
856            this(Basic1D.instance);
857        }
858
859        public InverseLayered1D(Noise1D basis) {
860            this(basis, 2);
861        }
862
863        public InverseLayered1D(Noise1D basis, final int octaves) {
864            this(basis, octaves, 1.0);
865        }
866        public InverseLayered1D(Noise1D basis, final int octaves, double frequency) {
867            this.basis = basis;
868            this.frequency = frequency;
869            this.octaves = Math.max(1, Math.min(63, octaves));
870        }
871        public InverseLayered1D(Noise1D basis, final int octaves, double frequency, double lacunarity){
872            this(basis, octaves, frequency);
873            this.lacunarity = lacunarity;
874        }
875
876        @Override
877        public double getNoise(double x) {
878            x *= frequency;
879            int s = 1 << (octaves - 1);
880            double n = 0.0, i_s = 1.0 / lacunarity;
881            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s >>= 1) {
882                n += basis.getNoise(x * (i_s *= lacunarity) + (o << 6)) * s;
883            }
884            return n / ((1 << octaves) - 1.0);
885        }
886
887        @Override
888        public double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, long seed) {
889            x *= frequency;
890            int s = 1 << (octaves - 1);
891            double n = 0.0, i_s = 1.0 / lacunarity;
892            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s >>= 1) {
893                n += basis.getNoiseWithSeed(x * (i_s *= lacunarity), (seed += 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L)) * s;
894            }
895            return n / ((1 << octaves) - 1.0);
896        }
897    }

1142            this(basis, octaves, 1.0);
1143        }
1144        public InverseLayered6D(Noise6D basis, final int octaves, double frequency) {
1145            this.basis = basis;
1146            this.frequency = frequency;
1147            this.octaves = Math.max(1, Math.min(63, octaves));
1148        }
1149        public InverseLayered6D(Noise6D basis, final int octaves, double frequency, double lacunarity){
1150            this(basis, octaves, frequency);
1151            this.lacunarity = lacunarity;
1152        }
1153
1154        @Override
1155        public double getNoise(double x, double y, double z, double w, double u, double v) {
1156            x *= frequency;
1157            y *= frequency;
1158            z *= frequency;
1159            w *= frequency;
1160            u *= frequency;
1161            v *= frequency;
1162            int s = 1 << (octaves - 1);
1163            double n = 0.0, i_s = 1.0 / lacunarity;
1164            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s >>= 1) {
1165                n += basis.getNoise(x * (i_s *= lacunarity) + (o << 6), y * i_s + (o << 7), z * i_s + (o << 8)
1166                        , w * i_s + (o << 9), u * i_s + (o << 10), v * i_s + (o << 11)) * s;
1167            }
1168            return n / ((1 << octaves) - 1.0);
1169        }
1170
1171        @Override
1172        public double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, double y, double z, double w, double u, double v, long seed) {
1173            x *= frequency;
1174            y *= frequency;
1175            z *= frequency;
1176            w *= frequency;
1177            u *= frequency;
1178            v *= frequency;
1179            int s = 1 << (octaves - 1);
1180            double n = 0.0, i_s = 1.0 / lacunarity;
1181            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s >>= 1) {
1182                n += basis.getNoiseWithSeed(x * (i_s *= lacunarity), y * i_s, z * i_s
1183                        , w * i_s, u * i_s, v * i_s, (seed += 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L)) * s;
1184            }
1185            return n / ((1 << octaves) - 1.0);
1186        }
1187    }
1188

1543    public static class Ridged1D implements Noise1D {
1544        protected int octaves;
1545        public double frequency;
1546        protected Noise1D basis;
1547
1548        public Ridged1D() {
1549            this(Basic1D.instance, 2, 1.25);
1550        }
1551
1552        public Ridged1D(Noise1D basis) {
1553            this(basis, 2, 1.25);
1554        }
1555
1556        public Ridged1D(Noise1D basis, int octaves, double frequency) {
1557            this.basis = basis;
1558            this.frequency = frequency;
1559            setOctaves(octaves);
1560        }
1561
1562        public void setOctaves(int octaves)
1563        {
1564            this.octaves = Math.max(1, Math.min(63, octaves));
1565        }
1566
1567        @Override
1568        public double getNoise(double x) {
1569            double sum = 0.0, n, exp = 2.0, correction = 0.0;
1570            x *= frequency;
1571            for (int i = 0; i < octaves; i++) {
1572                n = basis.getNoise(x + (i << 6));
1573                n = 1.0 - Math.abs(n);
1574                correction += (exp *= 0.5);
1575                sum += n * exp;
1576                x *= 2.0;
1577            }
1578            return sum * 2.0 / correction - 1.0;
1579        }
1580
1581        @Override
1582        public double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, long seed) {
1583            double sum = 0.0, n, exp = 2.0, correction = 0.0;
1584            x *= frequency;
1585            for (int i = 0; i < octaves; i++) {
1586                n = basis.getNoiseWithSeed(x, (seed += 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L));
1587                n = 1.0 - Math.abs(n);
1588                correction += (exp *= 0.5);
1589                sum += n * exp;
1590                x *= 2.0;
1591            }
1592            return sum * 2.0 / correction - 1.0;
1593        }
1594    }
1595
1596    public static class Ridged2D implements Noise2D {
1597        protected int octaves;
1598        public double frequency;
1599        protected Noise2D basis;
1600
1601        public Ridged2D() {
1602            this(SeededNoise.instance, 2, 1.25);
1603        }
1604
1605        public Ridged2D(Noise2D basis) {
1606            this(basis, 2, 1.25);
1607        }
1608
1609        public Ridged2D(Noise2D basis, int octaves, double frequency) {
1610            this.basis = basis;
1611            this.frequency = frequency;
1612            setOctaves(octaves);
1613        }
1614
1615        public void setOctaves(int octaves)
1616        {
1617            this.octaves = Math.max(1, Math.min(63, octaves));
1618        }
1619
1620        @Override
1621        public double getNoise(double x, double y) {
1622            double sum = 0.0, n, exp = 2.0, correction = 0.0;
1623            x *= frequency;
1624            y *= frequency;
1625            for (int i = 0; i < octaves; i++) {
1626                n = basis.getNoise(x + (i << 6), y + (i << 7)); // n is between -1 and 1
1627                n = 1.0 - Math.abs(n);                          // n is now between 0 and 1
1628                correction += (exp *= 0.5);                     // exp goes to 1 here, correction too
1629                sum += n * exp;                                 // sum is between 0 and 1
1630                x *= 2.0;                                       // exaggerate details for the next
1631                y *= 2.0;                                       // octave, by zooming in
1632            }
1633            return sum * 2.0 / correction - 1.0;                // for 1 octave, this is between -1 and 1
1634        }
1635
1636        @Override
1637        public double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, double y, long seed) {
1638            double sum = 0.0, n, exp = 2.0, correction = 0.0;
1639            x *= frequency;
1640            y *= frequency;
1641            for (int i = 0; i < octaves; i++) { 
1642                n = basis.getNoiseWithSeed(x, y, (seed += 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L));
1643                n = 1.0 - Math.abs(n);
1644                correction += (exp *= 0.5);
1645                sum += n * exp;
1646                x *= 2.0;
1647                y *= 2.0;
1648            }
1649            return sum * 2.0 / correction - 1.0;
1650        }
1651    }
1652
1653    public static class Ridged3D implements Noise3D {
1654        protected int octaves;
1655        public double frequency;
1656        protected Noise3D basis;
1657        public Ridged3D() {
1658            this(SeededNoise.instance, 2, 1.25);
1659        }
1660
1661        public Ridged3D(Noise3D basis) {
1662            this(basis, 2, 1.25);
1663        }
1664
1665        public Ridged3D(Noise3D basis, int octaves) {
1666            this(basis, octaves, 1.25);
1667        }
1668        public Ridged3D(Noise3D basis, int octaves, double frequency) {
1669            this.basis = basis;
1670            this.frequency = frequency;
1671            setOctaves(octaves);
1672        }
1673        public void setOctaves(int octaves)
1674        {
1675            this.octaves = Math.max(1, Math.min(63, octaves));
1676        }
1677
1678        @Override
1679        public double getNoise(double x, double y, double z) {
1680            double sum = 0.0, n, exp = 2.0, correction = 0.0;
1681            x *= frequency;
1682            y *= frequency;
1683            z *= frequency;
1684            for (int i = 0; i < octaves; ++i) {
1685                n = basis.getNoise(x + (i << 6), y + (i << 7), z + (i << 8));
1686                n = 1.0 - Math.abs(n);
1687                correction += (exp *= 0.5);
1688                sum += n * exp;
1689                x *= 2.0;
1690                y *= 2.0;
1691                z *= 2.0;
1692            }
1693            return sum * 2.0 / correction - 1.0;
1694        }
1695
1696        @Override
1697        public double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, double y, double z, long seed) {
1698            double sum = 0.0, n, exp = 2.0, correction = 0.0;
1699            x *= frequency;
1700            y *= frequency;
1701            z *= frequency;
1702            for (int i = 0; i < octaves; ++i) {
1703                n = basis.getNoiseWithSeed(x, y, z, (seed += 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L));
1704                n = 1.0 - Math.abs(n);
1705                correction += (exp *= 0.5);
1706                sum += n * exp;
1707                x *= 2.0;
1708                y *= 2.0;
1709                z *= 2.0;
1710            }
1711            return sum * 2.0 / correction - 1.0;
1712        }
1713    }
1714
1715
1716    public static class Ridged4D implements Noise4D {
1717        protected int octaves;
1718        public double frequency;
1719        public Noise4D basis;
1720
1721        public Ridged4D() {
1722            this(SeededNoise.instance, 2, 1.25);
1723        }
1724
1725        public Ridged4D(Noise4D basis) {
1726            this(basis, 2, 1.25);
1727        }
1728
1729        public Ridged4D(Noise4D basis, int octaves, double frequency) {
1730            this.basis = basis;
1731            this.frequency = frequency;
1732            setOctaves(octaves);
1733        }
1734        public void setOctaves(int octaves)
1735        {
1736            this.octaves = Math.max(1, Math.min(63, octaves));
1737        }
1738
1739        @Override
1740        public double getNoise(double x, double y, double z, double w) {
1741            double sum = 0.0, n, exp = 2.0, correction = 0.0;
1742            x *= frequency;
1743            y *= frequency;
1744            z *= frequency;
1745            w *= frequency;
1746            for (int i = 0; i < octaves; ++i) {
1747                n = basis.getNoise(x + (i << 6), y + (i << 7), z + (i << 8), w + (i << 9));
1748                n = 1.0 - Math.abs(n);
1749                correction += (exp *= 0.5);
1750                sum += n * exp;
1751                x *= 2.0;
1752                y *= 2.0;
1753                z *= 2.0;
1754                w *= 2.0;
1755            }
1756            return sum * 2.0 / correction - 1.0;
1757        }
1758
1759        @Override
1760        public double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, double y, double z, double w, long seed) {
1761            double sum = 0.0, n, exp = 2.0, correction = 0.0;
1762            x *= frequency;
1763            y *= frequency;
1764            z *= frequency;
1765            w *= frequency;
1766            for (int i = 0; i < octaves; ++i) {
1767                n = basis.getNoiseWithSeed(x, y, z, w, (seed += 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L));
1768                n = 1.0 - Math.abs(n);
1769                correction += (exp *= 0.5);
1770                sum += n * exp;
1771                x *= 2.0;
1772                y *= 2.0;
1773                z *= 2.0;
1774                w *= 2.0;
1775            }
1776            return sum * 2.0 / correction - 1.0;
1777        }
1778    }
1779

1820                y *= 2.0;
1821                z *= 2.0;
1822                w *= 2.0;
1823                u *= 2.0;
1824            }

1838                        w, u, (seed += 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L));

1927    public static class Turbulent2D implements Noise2D {
1928        protected int octaves;
1929        protected Noise2D basis, disturbance;
1930        public double frequency;
1931        protected double correction;
1932
1933        public Turbulent2D() {
1934            this(SeededNoise.instance, alternate, 1);
1935        }
1936
1937        public Turbulent2D(Noise2D basis, Noise2D disturb) {
1938            this(basis, disturb, 1);
1939        }
1940
1941        public Turbulent2D(Noise2D basis, Noise2D disturb, final int octaves) {
1942            this(basis, disturb, octaves, 1.0);
1943        }
1944        public Turbulent2D(Noise2D basis, Noise2D disturb, final int octaves, final double frequency) {
1945            this.basis = basis;
1946            this.frequency = frequency;
1947            disturbance = disturb;
1948            this.octaves = Math.max(1, Math.min(63, octaves));
1949            correction = 1.0 / ((1 << this.octaves) - 1.0);
1950        }
1951
1952        @Override
1953        public double getNoise(double x, double y) {
1954            x *= frequency;
1955            y *= frequency;
1956            x += disturbance.getNoise(x, y);
1957            int s = 1;
1958            double n = 0.0, i_s = 2.0;
1959            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s <<= 1) {
1960                i_s *= 0.5;
1961                n += basis.getNoise(x * i_s + (o << 6), y * i_s + (o << 7)) * s;
1962            }
1963            return n * correction;
1964        }
1965
1966        @Override
1967        public double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, double y, long seed) {
1968            x *= frequency;
1969            y *= frequency;
1970            x += disturbance.getNoiseWithSeed(x, y, seed);
1971            int s = 1;
1972            double n = 0.0, i_s = 2.0;
1973            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s <<= 1) {
1974                i_s *= 0.5;
1975                n += basis.getNoiseWithSeed(x * i_s, y * i_s, seed += 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L) * s;
1976            }
1977            return n * correction;
1978        }
1979    }

2153    public static class Viny2D implements Noise2D {
2154        protected int octaves;
2155        protected Noise2D basis, disturbance;
2156        public double frequency;
2157
2158        public Viny2D() {
2159            this(SeededNoise.instance, alternate, 1);
2160        }
2161
2162        public Viny2D(Noise2D basis, Noise2D disturb) {
2163            this(basis, disturb, 1);
2164        }
2165
2166        public Viny2D(Noise2D basis, Noise2D disturb, final int octaves) {
2167            this(basis, disturb, octaves, 1.0);
2168        }
2169        public Viny2D(Noise2D basis, Noise2D disturb, final int octaves, final double frequency) {
2170            this.basis = basis;
2171            this.frequency = frequency;
2172            disturbance = disturb;
2173            this.octaves = Math.max(1, Math.min(63, octaves));
2174        }
2175
2176        @Override
2177        public double getNoise(double x, double y) {
2178            x *= frequency;
2179            y *= frequency;
2180            int s = 2 << (octaves - 1);
2181            double n = 0.0, i_s = 1.0 / s, xx, yy;
2182            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++) {
2183                xx = x * (i_s *= 2.0) + (o << 6);
2184                yy = y * i_s + (o << 7);
2185                n += basis.getNoise(xx, yy) * s + disturbance.getNoise(xx, yy) * (s >>= 1);
2186            }
2187            return n / ((3 << octaves) - 3.0);
2188        }
2189
2190        @Override
2191        public double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, double y, long seed) {
2192            x *= frequency;
2193            y *= frequency;
2194            int s = 2 << (octaves - 1);
2195            double n = 0.0, i_s = 1.0 / s, xx, yy;
2196            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++) {
2197                xx = x * (i_s *= 2.0) + (o << 6);
2198                yy = y * i_s + (o << 7);
2199                n += basis.getNoiseWithSeed(xx, yy, seed) * s + disturbance.getNoiseWithSeed(xx, yy, seed) * (s >>= 1);
2200            }
2201            return n / ((3 << octaves) - 3.0);
2202        }
2203    }

2231            z *= frequency;

2233            double n = 0.0, i_s = 1.0 / s, xx, yy, zz;

2249            double n = 0.0, i_s = 1.0 / s, xx, yy, zz;
2250            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++) {
2251                seed += 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L;
2252                xx = x * (i_s *= 2.0) + (o << 6);
2253                yy = y * i_s + (o << 7);
2254                zz = z * i_s + (o << 8);
2255                n += basis.getNoiseWithSeed(xx, yy, zz, seed) * s + disturbance.getNoiseWithSeed(xx, yy, zz, seed) * (s >>= 1);
2256            }

2327        }
2328
2329        public Viny6D(Noise6D basis, Noise6D disturb) {
2330            this(basis, disturb, 1);
2331        }
2332
2333        public Viny6D(Noise6D basis, Noise6D disturb, final int octaves) {
2334            this(basis, disturb, octaves, 1.0);
2335        }
2336        public Viny6D(Noise6D basis, Noise6D disturb, final int octaves, final double frequency) {
2337            this.basis = basis;
2338            this.frequency = frequency;
2339            disturbance = disturb;
2340            this.octaves = Math.max(1, Math.min(63, octaves));
2341        }
2342        @Override
2343        public double getNoise(double x, double y, double z, double w, double u, double v) {
2344            x *= frequency;
2345            y *= frequency;
2346            z *= frequency;
2347            w *= frequency;
2348            u *= frequency;
2349            v *= frequency;
2350            int s = 2 << (octaves - 1);
2351            double n = 0.0, i_s = 1.0 / s, xx, yy, zz, ww, uu, vv;
2352            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++) {
2353                xx = x * (i_s *= 2.0) + (o << 6);
2354                yy = y * i_s + (o << 7);
2355                zz = z * i_s + (o << 8);
2356                ww = w * i_s + (o << 9);
2357                uu = u * i_s + (o << 10);
2358                vv = v * i_s + (o << 11);
2359                n += basis.getNoise(xx, yy, zz, ww, uu, vv) * s + disturbance.getNoise(xx, yy, zz, ww, uu, vv) * (s >>= 1);
2360            }
2361            return n / ((3 << octaves) - 3.0);
2362        }
2363
2364        @Override
2365        public double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, double y, double z, double w, double u, double v, long seed) {
2366            x *= frequency;
2367            y *= frequency;
2368            z *= frequency;
2369            w *= frequency;
2370            u *= frequency;
2371            v *= frequency;
2372            int s = 2 << (octaves - 1);
2373            double n = 0.0, i_s = 1.0 / s, xx, yy, zz, ww, uu, vv;
2374            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++) {
2375                seed += 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L;
2376                xx = x * (i_s *= 2.0) + (o << 6);
2377                yy = y * i_s + (o << 7);
2378                zz = z * i_s + (o << 8);
2379                ww = w * i_s + (o << 9);
2380                uu = u * i_s + (o << 10);
2381                vv = v * i_s + (o << 11);
2382                n += basis.getNoiseWithSeed(xx, yy, zz, ww, uu, vv, seed) * s + disturbance.getNoiseWithSeed(xx, yy, zz, ww, uu, vv, seed) * (s >>= 1);
2383            }
2384            return n / ((3 << octaves) - 3.0);
2385        }
2386    }
2387
2388
2389    public static class Slick2D implements Noise2D {
2390        protected int octaves;
2391        protected Noise2D basis, disturbance;
2392
2393        public Slick2D() {
2394            this(SeededNoise.instance, alternate, 1);
2395        }
2396
2397        public Slick2D(Noise2D basis, Noise2D disturb) {
2398            this(basis, disturb, 1);
2399        }
2400
2401        public Slick2D(Noise2D basis, Noise2D disturb, final int octaves) {
2402            this.basis = basis;
2403            disturbance = disturb;
2404            this.octaves = Math.max(1, Math.min(63, octaves));
2405        }
2406
2407        @Override
2408        public double getNoise(final double x, final double y) {
2409            double n = 0.0, i_s = 1.0, xx, yy;
2410            int s = 1 << (octaves - 1);
2411            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s >>= 1) {
2412                xx = x * (i_s *= 0.5) + (o << 6);
2413                yy = y * i_s + (o << 7);
2414                n += basis.getNoise(xx + disturbance.getNoise(x, y), yy) * s;
2415            }
2416            return n / ((1 << octaves) - 1.0);
2417        }
2418
2419        @Override
2420        public double getNoiseWithSeed(final double x, final double y, long seed) {
2421            double n = 0.0, i_s = 1.0, xx, yy;
2422
2423            int s = 1 << (octaves - 1);
2424            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s >>= 1) {
2425                seed += 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L;
2426                xx = x * (i_s *= 0.5) + (o << 6);
2427                yy = y * i_s + (o << 7);
2428                n += basis.getNoiseWithSeed(xx + disturbance.getNoiseWithSeed(x, y, seed), yy, seed) * s;
2429            }
2430            return n / ((1 << octaves) - 1.0);
2431        }
2432    }

2470                xx = x * (i_s *= 0.5) + (o << 6);
2471                yy = y * i_s + (o << 7);
2472                zz = z * i_s + (o << 8);
2473                n += basis.getNoiseWithSeed(xx + disturbance.getNoiseWithSeed(x, y, z, seed), yy, zz, seed) * s;
2474            }
2475            return n / ((1 << octaves) - 1.0);
2476        }

2567                zz = z * i_s + (o << 8);
2568                ww = w * i_s + (o << 9);
2569                uu = u * i_s + (o << 10);
2570                vv = v * i_s + (o << 11);
2571                n += basis.getNoiseWithSeed(xx + disturbance.getNoiseWithSeed(x, y, z, w, u, v, seed), yy, zz, ww, uu, vv, seed) * s;
2572            }
2573            return n / ((1 << octaves) - 1.0);
2574        }

2578    public static class Exponential1D implements Noise1D {
2579        protected Noise1D basis;
2580        protected double sharpness, adjustment;
2581        public Exponential1D() {
2582            this(Basic1D.instance);
2583        }
2584
2585        public Exponential1D(Noise1D basis) {
2586            this(basis, 0.125);
2587        }
2588        public Exponential1D(Noise1D basis, double sharpness) {
2589            this.basis = basis;
2590            this.sharpness = sharpness - fastFloor(sharpness) - 1.0;
2591            this.adjustment = 2.0 / Math.log1p(this.sharpness * 0.9999999999999999);
2592            this.sharpness *= 0.5;
2593        }
2594
2595
2596        @Override
2597        public double getNoise(double x) {
2598            return Math.log(1.0 + sharpness * (basis.getNoise(x) + 1.0)) * adjustment - 1.0;
2599        }
2600
2601        @Override
2602        public double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, long seed) {
2603            return Math.log(1.0 + sharpness * (basis.getNoiseWithSeed(x, seed) + 1.0)) * adjustment - 1.0;
2604        }
2605    }
2606

2743    /**
2744     * Used to add an extra parameter to 3D noise, such as one based on rotation, time, or some non-spatial component.
2745     * Adding a sine wave as the {@link #w} value to a world made with 3D noise results in
2746     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/w55JXtX.gif">something that looks like this</a>.
2747     */
2748    public static class Adapted3DFrom4D implements Noise3D {
2749        public Noise4D basis;
2750        public double w;
2751        public Adapted3DFrom4D() {
2752            this(ClassicNoise.instance);
2753        }
2754
2755        public Adapted3DFrom4D(Noise4D basis) {
2756            this.basis = basis;
2757        }
2758
2759        public double getW() {
2760            return w;
2761        }
2762
2763        public void setW(double w) {
2764            this.w = w;
2765        }
2766
2767        @Override
2768        public double getNoise(double x, double y, double z) {
2769            return basis.getNoise(x, y, z, w);
2770        }
2771
2772        @Override
2773        public double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, double y, double z, long seed) {
2774            return basis.getNoiseWithSeed(x, y, z, w, seed);
2775        }
2776    }
2777
2778    /**
2779     * Used to add extra parameters to 3D noise, such as those based on rotation, time, or some non-spatial component.
2780     * Using {@link #setExtras(double)} to set {@link #w} and {@link #u} in a world made with 3D noise results in
2781     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/zN2OmWx.gif">something that looks like this</a>.
2782     */
2783    public static class Adapted3DFrom5D implements Noise3D {
2784        public Noise5D basis;
2785        public double w, u;
2786        public Adapted3DFrom5D() {
2787            this(ClassicNoise.instance);
2788        }
2789
2790        public Adapted3DFrom5D(Noise5D basis) {
2791            this.basis = basis;
2792        }
2793
2794        public double getW() {
2795            return w;
2796        }
2797
2798        public void setW(double w) {
2799            this.w = w;
2800        }
2801
2802        public double getU() {
2803            return u;
2804        }
2805
2806        public void setU(double u) {
2807            this.u = u;
2808        }
2809
2810        /**
2811         * This sets the two extra noise parameters given one parameter, theta, which is treated as looping over a
2812         * circle of different w and u values, with one cycle equal to a change of 1.0 in theta.
2813         * @param theta only the fractional part matters; used to set both w and u. Cycles if it goes past an integer.
2814         */
2815        public void setExtras(double theta) {
2816            w = NumberTools.cos_(theta);
2817            u = NumberTools.sin_(theta);
2818        }
2819
2820        @Override
2821        public double getNoise(double x, double y, double z) {
2822            return basis.getNoise(x, y, z, w, u);
2823        }
2824
2825        @Override
2826        public double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, double y, double z, long seed) {
2827            return basis.getNoiseWithSeed(x, y, z, w, u, seed);
2828        }
2829    }
2830    
2831    public static class Seamless2D implements Noise2D {
2832        public Noise4D basis;
2833        public double inverseWidth = 0x1p-8, inverseHeight = 0x1p-8;
2834        
2835        public Seamless2D() {
2836            basis = new FoamNoise();
2837        }
2838        public Seamless2D(Noise4D basis) {
2839            this.basis = basis;
2840        }
2841        public Seamless2D(Noise4D basis, double width, double height) {
2842            this.basis = basis;
2843            this.inverseWidth = 1.0 / Math.abs(width);
2844            this.inverseHeight = 1.0 / Math.abs(height);
2845        }
2846
2847        @Override
2848        public double getNoise(double x, double y) {
2849            x *= inverseWidth;
2850            y *= inverseHeight;
2851            return basis.getNoise(NumberTools.cos_(x), NumberTools.sin_(x), NumberTools.cos_(y), NumberTools.sin_(y));
2852        }
2853
2854        @Override
2855        public double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, double y, long seed) {
2856            x *= inverseWidth;
2857            y *= inverseHeight;
2858            return basis.getNoiseWithSeed(NumberTools.cos_(x), NumberTools.sin_(x), NumberTools.cos_(y), NumberTools.sin_(y), seed);
2859        }
2860    }
2861
2862    /**
2863     * Produces a 2D array of noise with values from -1.0 to 1.0 that is seamless on all boundaries.
2864     * Uses (x,y) order. Allows a seed to change the generated noise.
2865     * If you need to call this very often, consider {@link #seamless2D(double[][], int, int)}, which re-uses the array.
2866     * @param width the width of the array to produce (the length of the outer layer of arrays)
2867     * @param height the height of the array to produce (the length of the inner arrays)
2868     * @param seed an int seed that affects the noise produced, with different seeds producing very different noise
2869     * @param octaves how many runs of differently sized and weighted noise generations to apply to the same area
2870     * @return a freshly-allocated seamless-bounded array, a {@code double[width][height]}.
2871     */
2872    public static double[][] seamless2D(final int width, final int height, final int seed, final int octaves) {
2873        return seamless2D(new double[width][height], seed, octaves);
2874    }
2875
2876    /**
2877     * Fills the given 2D array (modifying it) with noise, using values from -1.0 to 1.0, that is seamless on all
2878     * boundaries. This overload doesn't care what you use for x or y axes, it uses the exact size of fill fully.
2879     * Allows a seed to change the generated noise.
2880     * @param fill a 2D array of double; must be rectangular, so it's a good idea to create with {@code new double[width][height]} or something similar
2881     * @param seed an int seed that affects the noise produced, with different seeds producing very different noise
2882     * @param octaves how many runs of differently sized and weighted noise generations to apply to the same area
2883     * @return {@code fill}, after assigning it with seamless-bounded noise
2884     */
2885    public static double[][] seamless2D(final double[][] fill, final int seed, final int octaves) {
2886        return seamless2D(fill, seed, octaves, SeededNoise.instance);
2887    }
2888
2889    public static double total;
2890    /**
2891     * Fills the given 2D array (modifying it) with noise, using values from -1.0 to 1.0, that is seamless on all
2892     * boundaries. This overload doesn't care what you use for x or y axes, it uses the exact size of fill fully.
2893     * Allows a seed to change the generated noise. DOES NOT clear the values in fill, so if it already has non-zero
2894     * elements, the result will be different than if it had been cleared beforehand. That does allow you to utilize
2895     * this method to add multiple seamless noise values on top of each other, though that allows values to go above or
2896     * below the normal minimum and maximum (-1.0 to 1.0).
2897     * @param fill a 2D array of double; must be rectangular, so it's a good idea to create with {@code new double[width][height]} or something similar
2898     * @param seed an int seed that affects the noise produced, with different seeds producing very different noise
2899     * @param octaves how many runs of differently sized and weighted noise generations to apply to the same area
2900     * @return {@code fill}, after assigning it with seamless-bounded noise
2901     */
2902    public static double[][] seamless2D(final double[][] fill, long seed, final int octaves, final Noise.Noise4D generator) {
2903        final int height, width;
2904        if (fill == null || (width = fill.length) <= 0 || (height = fill[0].length) <= 0
2905                || octaves <= 0 || octaves >= 63)
2906            return fill;
2907        final double i_w = 6.283185307179586 / width, i_h = 6.283185307179586 / height;
2908        int s = 1 << (octaves - 1);
2909        total = 0.0;
2910        double p, q,
2911                ps, pc,
2912                qs, qc,
2913                i_s = 0.5 / s;
2914        for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s >>= 1) {
2915            seed += 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L;
2916            i_s *= 2.0;
2917            for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
2918                p = x * i_w;
2919                ps = NumberTools.sin(p) * i_s;
2920                pc = NumberTools.cos(p) * i_s;
2921                for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
2922                    q = y * i_h;
2923                    qs = NumberTools.sin(q) * i_s;
2924                    qc = NumberTools.cos(q) * i_s;
2925                    fill[x][y] += generator.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qc, qs, seed) * s;
2926                }
2927            }
2928        }
2929        i_s = 1.0 / ((1 << octaves) - 1.0);
2930        for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
2931            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
2932                total += (fill[x][y] *= i_s);
2933            }
2934        }
2935        return fill;
2936    }
2937
2938    /**
2939     * Produces a 3D array of noise with values from -1.0 to 1.0 that is seamless on all boundaries.
2940     * Allows a seed to change the generated noise.
2941     * Because most games that would use this would use it for maps, and maps are often top-down, the returned 3D array
2942     * uses the order (z,x,y), which allows a 2D slice of x and y to be taken as an element from the top-level array.
2943     * If you need to call this very often, consider {@link #seamless3D(double[][][], long, int)}, which re-uses the
2944     * array instead of re-generating it.
2945     * @param width the width of the array to produce (the length of the middle layer of arrays)
2946     * @param height the height of the array to produce (the length of the innermost arrays)
2947     * @param depth the depth of the array to produce (the length of the outermost layer of arrays)
2948     * @param seed an int seed that affects the noise produced, with different seeds producing very different noise
2949     * @param octaves how many runs of differently sized and weighted noise generations to apply to the same area
2950     * @return a freshly-allocated seamless-bounded array, a {@code double[depth][width][height]}.
2951     */
2952    public static double[][][] seamless3D(final int depth, final int width, final int height, final long seed, final int octaves) {
2953        return seamless3D(new double[depth][width][height], seed, octaves);
2954    }
2955
2956    /**
2957     * Fills the given 3D array (modifying it) with noise, using values from -1.0 to 1.0, that is seamless on all
2958     * boundaries. This overload doesn't care what you use for x, y, or z axes, it uses the exact size of fill fully.
2959     * Allows a seed to change the generated noise.
2960     * @param fill a 3D array of double; must be rectangular, so it's a good idea to create with {@code new double[depth][width][height]} or something similar
2961     * @param seed an int seed that affects the noise produced, with different seeds producing very different noise
2962     * @param octaves how many runs of differently sized and weighted noise generations to apply to the same area
2963     * @return {@code fill}, after assigning it with seamless-bounded noise
2964     */
2965    public static double[][][] seamless3D(final double[][][] fill, final long seed, final int octaves) {
2966        return seamless3D(fill, seed, octaves, SeededNoise.instance);
2967    }
2968
2969    /**
2970     * Fills the given 3D array (modifying it) with noise, using values from -1.0 to 1.0, that is seamless on all
2971     * boundaries. This overload doesn't care what you use for x, y, or z axes, it uses the exact size of fill fully.
2972     * Allows a seed to change the generated noise.
2973     * @param fill a 3D array of double; must be rectangular, so it's a good idea to create with {@code new double[depth][width][height]} or something similar
2974     * @param seed an int seed that affects the noise produced, with different seeds producing very different noise
2975     * @param octaves how many runs of differently sized and weighted noise generations to apply to the same area
2976     * @return {@code fill}, after assigning it with seamless-bounded noise
2977     */
2978    public static double[][][] seamless3D(final double[][][] fill, long seed, final int octaves, final Noise.Noise6D generator) {
2979        final int depth, height, width;
2980        if(fill == null || (depth = fill.length) <= 0 || (width = fill[0].length) <= 0 || (height = fill[0][0].length) <= 0
2981                || octaves <= 0 || octaves >= 63)
2982            return fill;
2983        final double i_w = 6.283185307179586 / width, i_h = 6.283185307179586 / height, i_d = 6.283185307179586 / depth;
2984        int s = 1<<(octaves-1);
2985        total = 0.0;
2986        double p, q, r,
2987                ps, pc,
2988                qs, qc,
2989                rs, rc, i_s = 0.5 / s;
2990        for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s>>=1) {
2991            seed += 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L;
2992            i_s *= 2.0;
2993            for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
2994                p = x * i_w;
2995                ps = NumberTools.sin(p) * i_s;
2996                pc = NumberTools.cos(p) * i_s;
2997                for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
2998                    q = y * i_h;
2999                    qs = NumberTools.sin(q) * i_s;
3000                    qc = NumberTools.cos(q) * i_s;
3001                    for (int z = 0; z < depth; z++) {
3002                        r = z * i_d;
3003                        rs = NumberTools.sin(r) * i_s;
3004                        rc = NumberTools.cos(r) * i_s;
3005                        fill[z][x][y] += generator.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qc, qs, rc, rs, seed) * s;
3006                    }
3007                }
3008            }
3009        }
3010        i_s = 1.0 / ((1<<octaves) - 1.0);
3011        for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
3012            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
3013                for (int z = 0; z < depth; z++) {
3014                    total += (fill[z][x][y] *= i_s);
3015                }
3016            }
3017        }
3018        return fill;
3019    }
3020
3021    /**
3022     * Fills the given 3D array (modifying it) with noise, using values from -1.0 to 1.0, that is seamless on all
3023     * boundaries. This overload doesn't care what you use for x, y, or z axes, it uses the exact size of fill fully.
3024     * Allows a seed to change the generated noise.
3025     * @param fill a 3D array of double; must be rectangular, so it's a good idea to create with {@code new double[depth][width][height]} or something similar
3026     * @param seed an int seed that affects the noise produced, with different seeds producing very different noise
3027     * @param octaves how many runs of differently sized and weighted noise generations to apply to the same area
3028     * @return {@code fill}, after assigning it with seamless-bounded noise
3029     */
3030    public static float[][][] seamless3D(final float[][][] fill, long seed, final int octaves) {
3031        final int depth, height, width;
3032        if(fill == null || (depth = fill.length) <= 0 || (width = fill[0].length) <= 0 || (height = fill[0][0].length) <= 0
3033                || octaves <= 0 || octaves >= 63)
3034            return fill;
3035        final double i_w = 6.283185307179586 / width, i_h = 6.283185307179586 / height, i_d = 6.283185307179586 / depth;
3036        int s = 1<<(octaves-1);
3037        double p, q, r,
3038                ps, pc,
3039                qs, qc,
3040                rs, rc, i_s = 0.5 / s;
3041        for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s>>=1) {
3042            seed += 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L;
3043            i_s *= 2.0;
3044            for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
3045                p = x * i_w;
3046                ps = NumberTools.sin(p) * i_s;
3047                pc = NumberTools.cos(p) * i_s;
3048                for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
3049                    q = y * i_h;
3050                    qs = NumberTools.sin(q) * i_s;
3051                    qc = NumberTools.cos(q) * i_s;
3052                    for (int z = 0; z < depth; z++) {
3053                        r = z * i_d;
3054                        rs = NumberTools.sin(r) * i_s;
3055                        rc = NumberTools.cos(r) * i_s;
3056                        fill[z][x][y] += SeededNoise.noise(pc, ps, qc, qs, rc, rs, seed) * s;
3057                    }
3058                }
3059            }
3060        }
3061        i_s = 1.0 / ((1<<octaves) - 1.0);
3062        for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
3063            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
3064                for (int z = 0; z < depth; z++) {
3065                    fill[z][x][y] *= i_s;
3066                }
3067            }
3068        }
3069        return fill;
3070    }
3071
3072    /**
3073     * Like {@link #seamless2D(double[][], long, int, Noise4D)}, but this produces 1D noise that "tiles" by repeating
3074     * its output every {@code sizeX} units that {@code x} increases or decreases by. This doesn't precalculate an
3075     * array, instead calculating just one value so that later calls with different x will tile seamlessly.
3076     * <br>
3077     * Internally, this just samples out of a circle from a source of 2D noise.
3078     * @param noise a Noise2D implementation such as a {@link SeededNoise} or {@link FastNoise}
3079     * @param x the x-coordinate to sample
3080     * @param sizeX the range of x to generate before repeating; must be greater than 0
3081     * @param seed the noise seed, as a long
3082     * @return continuous noise from -1.0 to 1.0, inclusive 
3083     */
3084    public static double seamless1D(Noise2D noise, double x, double sizeX, long seed)
3085    {
3086        x *= 6.283185307179586 / sizeX;
3087        return noise.getNoiseWithSeed(NumberTools.cos(x), NumberTools.sin(x), seed);
3088    }
3089
3090    /**
3091     * Like {@link #seamless2D(double[][], long, int, Noise4D)}, but this doesn't precalculate noise into an array,
3092     * instead calculating just one 2D point so that later calls with different x or y will tile seamlessly.
3093     * @param noise a Noise4D implementation such as a {@link SeededNoise} or {@link FastNoise}
3094     * @param x the x-coordinate to sample
3095     * @param y the y-coordinate to sample
3096     * @param sizeX the range of x to generate before repeating; must be greater than 0
3097     * @param sizeY the range of y to generate before repeating; must be greater than 0
3098     * @param seed the noise seed, as a long
3099     * @return continuous noise from -1.0 to 1.0, inclusive 
3100     */
3101    public static double seamless2D(Noise4D noise, double x, double y, double sizeX, double sizeY, long seed)
3102    {
3103        x *= 6.283185307179586 / sizeX;
3104        y *= 6.283185307179586 / sizeY;
3105        return noise.getNoiseWithSeed(NumberTools.cos(x), NumberTools.sin(x), NumberTools.cos(y), NumberTools.sin(y),
3106                seed);
3107    }
3108
3109
3110    /**
3111     * Like {@link #seamless3D(double[][][], long, int, Noise6D)}, but this doesn't precalculate noise into an array,
3112     * instead calculating just one 3D point so that later calls with different x, y, or z will tile seamlessly.
3113     * @param noise a Noise6D implementation such as a {@link SeededNoise} or {@link FastNoise}
3114     * @param x the x-coordinate to sample
3115     * @param y the y-coordinate to sample
3116     * @param z the z-coordinate to sample
3117     * @param sizeX the range of x to generate before repeating; must be greater than 0
3118     * @param sizeY the range of y to generate before repeating; must be greater than 0
3119     * @param sizeZ the range of z to generate before repeating; must be greater than 0
3120     * @param seed the noise seed, as a long
3121     * @return continuous noise from -1.0 to 1.0, inclusive 
3122     */
3123    public static double seamless3D(Noise6D noise, double x, double y, double z, double sizeX, double sizeY, double sizeZ, long seed)
3124    {
3125        x *= 6.283185307179586 / sizeX;
3126        y *= 6.283185307179586 / sizeY;
3127        z *= 6.283185307179586 / sizeZ;
3128        return noise.getNoiseWithSeed(NumberTools.cos(x), NumberTools.sin(x), NumberTools.cos(y), NumberTools.sin(y),
3129                NumberTools.cos(z), NumberTools.sin(z), seed);
3130    }
3131
3132    /**
3133     * A very simple 1D noise implementation, because a full-blown Perlin or Simplex noise implementation is probably
3134     * overkill for 1D noise. This does produce smoothly sloping lines, like Simplex noise does for higher dimensions.
3135     * The shape of the line varies over time, but <a href="https://i.imgur.com/83R3WLN.png">can look like this</a>.
3136     * If you give this a seed with {@link #getNoiseWithSeed(double, long)} instead of using {@link #getNoise(double)},
3137     * it will use a small extra step to adjust the spacing of peaks and valleys based on the seed, so getNoiseWithSeed
3138     * is slower than getNoise. If you use any Noise classes like {@link Noise.Layered1D}, they should use a seed anyway
3139     * because different octaves won't have different enough shapes otherwise.
3140     */
3141    public static class Basic1D implements Noise1D
3142    {
3143        public static final Basic1D instance = new Basic1D();
3144        public double alter1, alter2, alter3, alter4;
3145        public long lastSeed;
3146        public Basic1D()
3147        {
3148            this(1L);
3149        }
3150        public Basic1D(long seed)
3151        {
3152            lastSeed = seed;
3153            alter1 = (DiverRNG.determine(seed) >> 11) * 0x1.8p-54;
3154            alter2 = (DiverRNG.determine(seed + 11111) >> 11) * 0x1p-53;
3155            alter3 = (DiverRNG.determine(seed + 22222) >> 11) * 0x1.8p-53;
3156            alter4 = (DiverRNG.determine(seed + 33333) >> 11) * 0x1p-52;
3157        }
3158        @Override
3159        public double getNoise(double x) {
3160            return (cubicSway(x * alter1) * 0.4375f +
3161                    cubicSway(x * alter2) * 0.3125f +
3162                    cubicSway(x * alter3) * 0.1875f +
3163                    cubicSway(x * alter4) * 0.0625f);
3164        }
3165
3166        @Override
3167        public double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, long seed) {
3168            if(lastSeed != seed)
3169            {
3170                lastSeed = seed;
3171                alter1 = (DiverRNG.determine(seed) >> 11) * 0x1.8p-54;
3172                alter2 = (DiverRNG.determine(seed + 11111) >> 11) * 0x1p-53;
3173                alter3 = (DiverRNG.determine(seed + 22222) >> 11) * 0x1.8p-53;
3174                alter4 = (DiverRNG.determine(seed + 33333) >> 11) * 0x1p-52;
3175            }
3176            return (cubicSway(x * alter1) * 0.4375f +
3177                    cubicSway(x * alter2) * 0.3125f +
3178                    cubicSway(x * alter3) * 0.1875f +
3179                    cubicSway(x * alter4) * 0.0625f);
3180        }
3181        public static double cubicSway(double value)
3182        {
3183            long floor = (value >= 0.0 ? (long) value : (long) value - 1L);
3184            value -= floor;
3185            floor = (-(floor & 1L) | 1L);
3186            return value * value * (3.0 - 2.0 * value) * (floor << 1) - floor;
3187        }
3188
3189        public static double noise(double x, long seed) {
3190            final double
3191                    alter1 = (DiverRNG.determine(seed) >> 11) * 0x1.8p-54, 
3192                    alter2 = (DiverRNG.determine(seed + 11111) >> 11) * 0x1p-53, 
3193                    alter3 = (DiverRNG.determine(seed + 22222) >> 11) * 0x1.8p-53, 
3194                    alter4 = (DiverRNG.determine(seed + 33333) >> 11) * 0x1p-52;
3195            return (cubicSway(x * alter1) * 0.4375f +
3196                    cubicSway(x * alter2) * 0.3125f +
3197                    cubicSway(x * alter3) * 0.1875f +
3198                    cubicSway(x * alter4) * 0.0625f);
3199        }
3200    }
3201    public static class Sway1D implements Noise1D
3202    {
3203        public static final Sway1D instance = new Sway1D();
3204        public long seed;
3205        public Sway1D()
3206        {
3207            seed = 0L;
3208        }
3209        public Sway1D(long seed)
3210        {
3211            this.seed = seed;
3212        }
3213
3214        @Override
3215        public double getNoise(double x) {
3216            return NumberTools.swayRandomized(seed, x);
3217        }
3218
3219        @Override
3220        public double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, long seed) {
3221            return NumberTools.swayRandomized(seed, x);
3222        }
3223    }
3224    public static class Sway2D implements Noise2D
3225    {
3226        public static final Sway2D instance = new Sway2D();
3227        public long seed;

3229        {
3230            seed = 12345L;

3233        {
3234            this.seed = seed;
3235        }

3237        @Override
3238        public double getNoise(double x, double y) {

3240        }

3242        @Override
3243        public double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, double y, long seed) {
3244//            double xx = NumberTools.swayRandomized(seed - 0xC13FA9A902A6328FL, x + y) * 0.75,

3255//                    adjust1 = NumberTools.swayRandomized(seed + 0x8CB92BA72F3D8DD7L, x * 0.25 + y * -1.75) + 1.,
3256//                    adjust2 = NumberTools.swayRandomized(seed - 0x8CB92BA72F3D8DD7L, x + y) + 1.;

3260//                    + NumberTools.swayRandomized(seed + 0x8CB92BA72F3D8DD7L, x - y) * adjust2 
3261//                    ) * 0.75 + 0.5);
3262            final long floorX = x >= 0.0 ? (long) x : (long) x - 1L,
3263                    floorY = y >= 0.0 ? (long) y : (long) y - 1L;
3264//            long seedX = seed * 0xC13FA9A902A6328FL + floorX * 0x91E10DA5C79E7B1DL,
3265//                    seedY = seed * 0x91E10DA5C79E7B1DL + floorY * 0xC13FA9A902A6328FL;
3266//            final long startX = ((seedX ^ (seedX >>> 25)) * (seedX | 0xA529L)),
3267//                    endX = (((seedX += 0x91E10DA5C79E7B1DL) ^ (seedX >>> 25)) * (seedX | 0xA529L));
3268//            final long startY = ((seedY ^ (seedY >>> 25)) * (seedY | 0xA529L)),
3269//                    endY = (((seedY += 0xC13FA9A902A6328FL) ^ (seedY >>> 25)) * (seedY | 0xA529L));

3272//                    x0y1 = (int) (startX + endY >>> 56),
3273//                    x1y1 = (int) (endX + endY >>> 56);
3274            final int x0y0 = HastyPointHash.hash256(floorX, floorY, seed),
3275                    x1y0 = HastyPointHash.hash256(floorX+1, floorY, seed),
3276                    x0y1 = HastyPointHash.hash256(floorX, floorY+1, seed),
3277                    x1y1 = HastyPointHash.hash256(floorX+1, floorY+1, seed);
3278            x -= floorX;
3279            y -= floorY;
3280//            x *= x * (3.0 - 2.0 * x);
3281//            y *= y * (3.0 - 2.0 * y);
3282//            x *= x;
3283//            y *= y;

3285//            final double ix = (1 - x) * (1 - x), iy = (1 - y) * (1 - y);
3286//            final double ix = x, iy = y;
3287//            x = 1.0 - x;
3288//            y = 1.0 - y;
3289            //            double ret = ((ix * SeededNoise.phiGrad2[x0y0][0] + iy * SeededNoise.phiGrad2[x0y0][1])
3290//                    + (x * SeededNoise.phiGrad2[x1y0][0] + iy * SeededNoise.phiGrad2[x1y0][1])
3291//                    + (ix * SeededNoise.phiGrad2[x0y1][0] + y * SeededNoise.phiGrad2[x0y1][1])
3292//                    + (x * SeededNoise.phiGrad2[x1y1][0] + y * SeededNoise.phiGrad2[x1y1][1])
3293//            );
3294            return ((SeededNoise.grad2d[x0y0][0] + SeededNoise.grad2d[x0y0][1]) * (ix * iy)
3295                    + (SeededNoise.grad2d[x1y0][0] + SeededNoise.grad2d[x1y0][1]) * (x * iy)
3296                    + (SeededNoise.grad2d[x0y1][0] + SeededNoise.grad2d[x0y1][1]) * (ix * y)
3297                    + (SeededNoise.grad2d[x1y1][0] + SeededNoise.grad2d[x1y1][1]) * (x * y)
3298            ) * 0.7071067811865475;
3299//            long xf = x >= 0.0 ? (long) x : (long) x - 1L;
3300//            long yf = y >= 0.0 ? (long) y : (long) y - 1L;
3301//            long s = ((0x91E10DA5C79E7B1DL ^ seed ^ yf)) * 0xC13FA9A902A6328FL, s2 = ((0x91E10DA5C79E7B1DL ^ seed ^ yf + 1L)) * 0xC13FA9A902A6328FL;
3302//            double xSmall = x - xf;
3303//            //, 0xABC98388FB8FAC03L, 0x8CB92BA72F3D8DD7L

3305//                    start2 = (((s2 += xf * 0x6C8E9CF570932BD5L) ^ (s2 >>> 25)) * (s2 | 0xA529L)) * 0x0.fffffffffffffbp-63,
3306//                    end = (((s += 0x6C8E9CF570932BD5L) ^ (s >>> 25)) * (s | 0xA529L)) * 0x0.fffffffffffffbp-63,
3307//                    end2 = (((s2 += 0x6C8E9CF570932BD5L) ^ (s2 >>> 25)) * (s2 | 0xA529L)) * 0x0.fffffffffffffbp-63;
3308////            double x0y0 = HastyPointHash.hashAll(xf, yf, seed) * 0x0.fffffffffffffbp-63,
3309////                    x1y0 = HastyPointHash.hashAll(xf+1L, yf, seed) * 0x0.fffffffffffffbp-63,
3310////                    x0y1 = HastyPointHash.hashAll(xf, yf+1L, seed) * 0x0.fffffffffffffbp-63,
3311////                    x1y1 = HastyPointHash.hashAll(xf+1L, yf+1L, seed) * 0x0.fffffffffffffbp-63, y0, y1;
3312//            xSmall = xSmall * xSmall * (3.0 - 2.0 * xSmall);
